natural solution: So  $$y=-(x+7)-(-x+2)=-9.$$ If $x\geq 2$, both $x+7$ and $x-2$ are nonnegative.
So  $$y=x+7-x+2=9.$$ If $-7\leq x< 2$, $x+7$ is nonnegative and $x-2$ is negative.
So  $$y=x+7-(-x+2)=2x+5.$$ Then, $2(-7)+5=-9$, and $2(2)+5=9$. The function is increasing and continuous, so all values between $-9$ and $9$ are produced, and no others.

(* ### Problem

 ### Proof

 Thus the range is $y \in \boxed{[-9, 9]}$.
 *)

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = abs(x + 7) - abs(x - 2)"

shows  "y \<in> {-9..9}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
